description: Least positive multiple of n written in base 5 using only 0 and 1.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: N:= 100: # to get a(1) .. a(N)S:= [[1,1]]:A[1]:= 1:Todo:= {$2..N}:count:= 1:for d from 2 while count < N do  S:= map(t -> ([5*t[1],10*t[2]],[5*t[1]+1,10*t[2]+1]), S);  for p in S do    s:= p[1];    Ts:= select(t -> s mod t = 0, Todo);    Todo:= Todo minus Ts;    count:= count + nops(Ts);    for m in Ts do         A[m]:= p[2];    od  od;od:seq(A[n],n=1..N); # _Robert Israel_, Dec 28 2015
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {k=1; while (vecmax(digits(k*n, 5)) != 1, k++); subst(Pol(digits(k*n, 5)), x, 10);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 27 2015
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: a(33) corrected by _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 26 2015
